source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: Garzarolli et al. [4] showed that Zircaloy-2 post-transition corrosion rates obtained from $3 5 0 \mathrm { { \circ C } }$ autoclave data increased for $\Sigma A _ { i } < 1 0 ^ { - 1 8 }$ h, exhibited a minimum at $\Sigma A _ { i } = 1 0 ^ { - 1 7 }$ h and trended slightly higher for $\Sigma A _ { i } > 1 0 ^ { - 1 6 } \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$ .

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: However, both Garzarolli and the current work show specific anomalous behavior where the PTR of 0.35 mdd at $\Sigma A _ { i } = 1 0 ^ { - 1 8 } \mathrm { h }$ is substantially greater than the 0.25 mdd observed at $\Sigma A _ { i } = 1 0 ^ { - 1 9 } \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$ .

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: However, both Garzarolli and the current work show specific anomalous behavior where the PTR of 0.35 mdd at $\Sigma A _ { i } = 1 0 ^ { - 1 8 } \mathrm { h }$ is substantially greater than the 0.25 mdd observed at $\Sigma A _ { i } = 1 0 ^ { - 1 9 } \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$ .

evidence_span: Specifically, Charquet showed that $5 0 0 \mathrm { ‰}$ weight gains were substantially lower for material in which the (0002) poles are normal to the rolling plane $( \sinh \operatorname { g h } f _ { \scriptscriptstyle N } )$ , contrasted with the usual recrystallization texture for sheets where the (0002) poles are inclined at about $3 0 ^ { \circ }$ to the transverse direction (lower $f _ { N } ,$ .

evidence_span: we have observed improved corrosion performance of cold-worked $\mathbf { Z r { - } } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ with increasing iron content in the range 300 to $1 2 0 0 \ \mathrm { p p m }$ Fe in out-of-reactor short term $\left( < 3 0 0 \right.$ days) aqueous exposures

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk9
evidence_span: Our $3 6 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ testing of Zircaloy-2 shows quite good uniform corrosion behavior with an annealing parameter as low as $9 \times 1 0 ^ { - 2 0 } \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk9
evidence_span: Foster et al.9 recently published results which show a minimum required annealing parameter of $4 ~ \times$ $1 0 ^ { - 1 9 }$ h to provide good $4 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ steam corrosion resistance with Zircaloy-4

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk9
evidence_span: We have also explored the effects of very high annealing parameter $( > 6 \times 1 0 ^ { - 1 6 } \mathrm { ~ h } )$ on the $5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } / 2 4 . \mathrm { h }$ steam corrosion resistance of controlled composition Zircaloy-2

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk9
evidence_span: When quench rates exceed about $2 \%$ we see no evidence of nodule formation and weight gains are less than $7 5 \mathrm { \ m g } / \mathrm { d } \mathrm { m } ^ { 2 }$
